definitions.definition: to put something inside something else:
examples: Insert the key in/into the lock.

definitions.definition: to add writing to a text, form, etc.:
examples: I've filled in the form, but you still need to insert (= add) your bank details and date of birth.

definitions.definition: something that is made to go inside or into something else:
examples: These magazines have too many annoying inserts (= extra loose pages) advertising various products.
